name: Responsible Government at Last
description: The time has come to build a responsible, British-style government to our lands.

name: Border Infrastructure with South Africa
description: It would be wise to set up border fortifications to defend from possible incursions from our southern aggressor.

name: Issue Passports
description: It is essential for our new nation to give passports to our citizens.

name: Establish the Gonarezhou reserve
description: The Gonarezhou is vast and filled with beautiful wildlife, and we must keep it this way. We should consider declaring it a national reserve in order to better protect its natural state.

name: Combat Poaching
description: Poaching has become a large threat to the Rhodesian wildlife, it is essential that we take measures to eliminate the poaching of wildlife.

name: Attract Wildlife Tourism
description: Our natural wildlife is a gift. Knowing this, we could use it to our advantage by gaining some extra revenue by attracting safari tourism.

name: Anglicize the Bureaucracy
description: Now that we are, for the first time, beholden only to our own desires, we need no longer account for Afrikaans, the South African language rarely spoken north of the Limpopo, in our bureaucracy. English, and only English, shall do...

name: Invite Imperial Experts
description: It is utterly important that we invite experts from the crown to guide us in building up our newly independent homeland.

name: Expand the Native Reserves
description: The current native reserves are small and their people are overcrowded. It is only natural that we expand these reserves to allow for some prosperity in the native communities

name: Draft a Constitution
description: A constitution will provide us with stability and certainty of future governance. It is of the utmost priority that a constitution for Southern Rhodesia is drafted.

name: Establish the Southern Rhodesia Currency Board
description: In order to better manage the currency situation here in Rhodesia, we must establish a currency board which will guide this process.

name: Legalise Sweep-staking
description: Sweep staking, should it be legalised, would provide us with a large amount of much needed income. This course of action is necessary if we wish to continue to grow our new economy.

name: Bring back the Rhodesian Pound
description: Having regained our independence from the Union of South Africa, it would be most wise to restore our old currency - the Rhodesian Pound.

name: A Stable Administration
description: A responsible government brings prosperity and stability to a nation. With our fast growing economy, it is fair to call our administration stable.

name: Attract Immigrants
description: Rhodesia has always been a place desirable to immigrants. Encouraging furthe immigration and increasing the infrastructure required to receive them could only benefit us.

name: Cross the Zambezi
description: Across the Zambezi lays North Rhodesia, taken from the British after the collapse of their empire, we have yet to be under the same flag. However, an opportunity may just allow us to take back what is rightfully ours.

name: Reform the Education System
description: Our current education system, is... well, lacking to say the least. In order to better improve the welfare of our people, we must reform our system of education.

name: Establish The Supreme Court
description: An essential part of a Responsible Government is accountability, creating a supreme court to reside over the interpretation of laws and the constitution.

name: Curtail the Railway Unions
description: The railway unions are a nuisance for the progress of our nation. In order to advance our railways, we must suppress them.

name: Negotiate with the Railway Unions
description: While we could just suppress the unions, it may be more beneficial for the overall unity of the nation if we were to work with them.

name: The Salisbury-Beira Line
description: A massive project, it as been decided that a line will connect Salisbury and Beira by railroad.

name: Industrial Conciliation Act
description: The Industrial Conciliation Act borrows heavily from its South African counterpart with its end goal to protect the interest of white workers over their black counterparts.

name: Fixing the Damage
description: The Boers were not kind to us, with our civilian infrastructure heavily damaged during the fighting. Thanks to our Entente benefactors, we have the funds, and the means to make most needed repairs.

name: Expand the University College of Rhodesia
description: An initiative has been put into place to expand the University College of Rhodesia to promote the immigration of intellects to Southern Rhodesia and to allow for trades to be taught in an effort to kick start South Rhodesia economy

name: Expand our Infrastructure
description: Southern Rhodesia is fairly far away from... Basically everywhere besides South Africa. If we are to diversify our currently predominantly agricultural economy to seriously compete with our South African neighbours, we need to work on our national infrastructure.

name: Support the Rhodesia Sugar Refinery
description: Such cash crops, like sugar are vital to the recovery of the South Rhodesian economy. With this in mind, we shall support our local sugar refineries via the means of stimulus packages.

name: Develop Bulawayo Industry
description: Bulawayo has always been the centre of Rhodesian industrial hub. With further investment from the Entente, we further develop vital industrial hub.

name: Subsidies Northern Maize Farmers
description: Akin to our sugar industry, our maize production must be supported if we are to further recover our industries, with subsidies being afforded to our farmers.

name: Tariffs with South Africa
description: Relations are still rocky between Salisbury and Pretoria, with neither wishing to make any accommodations towards each other. With this, we must impose harsh tariffs on any goods that hail from South Africa, till such a time such accommodations are made.

name: Economic Reconciliation
description: Though we have had our differences, diplomats from both South Africa and Rhodesia have been looking to ease tensions. With this in mind, trade between the two nations has normalised, with both nations accepting each other goods.

name: Counter Cattle Diseases
description: With further research and development into preventives of diseases that effect our lucrative cattle industry has allowed for the use of more land previously unsuitable, allowing for a small expansion of rural towns within the country.

name: Invest in RCL&R Ltd.
description: RCL&R Ltd. have proven themselves to be a company worthy of investment, it would be wise to help their growth.

name: Economic Boom
description: Salisbury has recovered from the Third Boer War, and its economy has stabilised greatly.

name: Nationalise the Utility Companies
description: Under the control of the government, we will be better able to run the utilities of our nation.

name: Nationalise Rhodesian Railways
description: The railway companies have proven themselves to be unable to run the railways properly. It has been decided that they are to be nationalised.

name: Subsidise the Utility Companies
description: Instead of nationalisation of the utilities, it would be better if we were to give them subsidies to improve their growth.

name: Subsidise Rhodesian Railways
description: Instead of nationalisation of the railways, it would be better if we were to give them subsidies to improve their growth.

name: Support Salt Extraction
description: Rhodesia is not a particularly large exporter of salt products but miners have long-eyed up potential commercial reserves in mines and river-beds. With the debacle of the railways fixed, some additional funding will ensure that the salt-miners have access to good infrastructure, making the industry a valuable commodity.

name: Mobilise the Territorial Force
description: A rally cry has begun in Salisbury, with it being heard as far as Broken Hill. Young men are flocking to our cause to supplement our forces to fight off the Boer menace. With the territorial force in action, we can win this battle once and for all.

name: Requisition Necessary Supplies
description: We cannot hope to match the fiery war engines of our allies in the Northern hemisphere and so will have to make do with whatever comes to hand. Be they German arms smuggled from up North to dusty museum pieces, we must have arms and we must have factories to make them.

name: Emergency Fortifications
description: Being in the middle of the colonies and with a lack of natural defences to the South we'll need to make do by building whatever fortifications we can. Blockhouses, stockades and trenches will have to make do in lieu of concrete and iron but they're cheap and will still make do.

name: Reorganise the Rhodesian Staff Corps
description: The Rhodesian Staff Corps has been the primary military force of South Rhodesia for some time but the civil war has shown that it is currently in a lacking state and not prepared for the incoming conflicts. With some adjustments it can be a force of the modern century.

name: Establish the Salisbury Arsenal
description: Rhodesia currently lacks a proper military infrastructure of its own, we can start to rectify this by building a proper arsenal in the capital. Guns, bombs and artillery win wars.

name: Adopt Entente Weapon Standards
description: To ensure ease of supply maintenance, production and leasing, we will need to adopt official allied weapon standards. While many of our weapons have served as well, they're simply no longer up to scratch and we cannot afford to get finnicky over precious ammunition.

name: Expand River Patrol Forces
description: Rhodesia is a land-locked nation but one with a large swathe of volatile rivers that can house domestic insurgents and foreign agents. While a brown-water navy is no substitute for the RN, it can give us some valuable sailing experience.

name: The Rhodesian Coast Guard
description: Against the odds we have secured a coast and access to the sea. While we're not exactly a seafaring nation, we shall follow in Father Britain's tradition and establish our own coast guard.

name: State Grants for Munition Factories
description: While we are starting to see the birth of a military industry, we would do well to empower the local captains of industry to help build it further. State grants will ensure that new munition plants are on the construction agenda for the next few years.

name: The South Rhodesian Air Corps
description: Following in the footsteps of modern warfare developments, it is high time that we formed our own air service to support our infantry on the battlefield.

name: Frontier Listening Posts
description: Knowledge is half the battle and being aware of enemy troop movements will give our forces an edge in any conflict. Erecting covert listening posts in the frontier will be great boon to our efforts.

name: Land-Air Coordination Practice
description: Air units cooperating with their land counterparts is a necessary component of modern warfare, we should ensure that our infantry and pilots are trained well in the practice so as to avoid any mishaps.

name: The Ottawa Air Lease
description: Airpower will be key to the next war, but lacking the planes or know-how in designing them, our masters in Ottawa have offered to provide us with planes to reverse engineer and put towards our own fledgling air corps.

name: Incorporation of the BSAP Units
description: The British South Africa Police is, officially, the police force for the territory of Rhodesia but the line between police and army is blurred. An already trained paramilitary force, the BSAP could easily form the bedrock of our army if we opt to incorporate them properly.

name: Create the Rhodesian African Rifles
description: While there has been reservations about their integration, coloured and African troops proved their mettle in the first Weltkrieg and askari have countlessly shown themselves to be loyal. By creating a unit of African soldiers, staffed by white NCOs, we can tap into considerable reserves.

name: Bush Warfare Exercises
description: Large swathes of Rhodesia is covered by thick jungles and deep bush, hardly the most hospitable terrain for soldiers and fighting alike. However, if we to put our soldiers through specialised training camps in the jungle, we can ensure that they will be suited to all kinds of African warfare.

name: Pursue Ground Force Motorisation
description: Largely flat, Rhodesia makes itself an ideal terrain for speed-based warfare with trucks, cars and armoured personnel vehicles becoming ever more important. Motorisation of our ground forces is essential to keeping them up to scratch.

name: Light Infantry Training
description: It is imperative that our forces remain highly mobile and skilled in the art of movement. Having bulky units will just bog our forces down, instead our soldiers must learn how to be swift and light-footed.

name: Study Canadian Tank Development
description: Lacking our own designers we must rely on our Entente allies for military development. With tanks becoming an increasingly important part of warfare we should study Canadian tanks and how they might be used in Rhodesia.

name: Expand the Integrated Hospital Units
description: Fighting in Africa is a nasty and brutal affair with all manner of tropical ailments waiting in the wings to snatch a wounded soldier. By expanding the integrated army hospital units we can make sure that more of our men return to the battlefield.

name: Procure Canadian Advisors
description: With the army rapidly expanding, there is a great need for Canadian military advisors and instructors that our own forces can consult. Doctrines can't be developed by veterancy alone!

name: Reform the Internal Command Structure
description: With major military reforms underway, the internal command structure is showing its inefficiencies and age. A major overhaul is needed to keep it at the peak of efficiency.

name: Form the Rhodesian Intelligence Corps
description: Warfare is changing and is now fought in the shadows as well as the battlefield. Lacking our own intelligence service, it is a priority we rectify this at once and see that our secrets are safeguarded.

name: Integrate the Northern Regiments
description: Many North Rhodesians crossed the Zambesi to fight during our struggle and since then have formed unofficial paramilitary 'Northern Regiments'. Highly skilled, very eager and trained in warfare more suited to climates North of the Zambesi, they could prove a great boon to us.

name: Experimental Special Forces Training
description: Owing to our experiences in the Boer War, it has been proposed that we investigate the possibility of experimental parachutist forces. Quick and agile, death from above could very well become the killing blow for our opponents.
